Description: Shallow pottery bowl; sharp carination between base (slighty sloping towards central point) and flaring straight wall, ledged rim (for lid); micaceous red Nile silt clay with numerous white lime inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Listed in Philadelphia register as coming from Tell Dafana (findspot 94 & 225, kitchen of the kasr), but scratched number 94 might refer to well 94 in sanctuary of Apollo. The fabric is untypical for Tell Defana pottery.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.102)
